summary: This appears to be a jail observation log, likely from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), documenting the suicide watch or psychological observation of an inmate. The log tracks meals, liquids, showers, and behavioral observations over multiple days. The inmate's name is heavily redacted but context suggests it is Jeffrey Epstein, who was in custody at the time.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the observation log, tracked for meals, liquids, showers, and behavior while in custody. The name is partially redacted but contextually clear.

events.title: Jail Suicide Watch/Psychological Observation
events.description: An inmate (contextually Jeffrey Epstein) is placed under suicide watch or psychological observation in jail. The log documents daily checks on meals, liquids, showers, and behavioral notes.

keyFacts: The document is a jail observation log for an inmate on suicide watch or psychological observation.
The inmate's name is redacted but contextual clues (dates, 'EPSTEIN' partially visible in some entries) strongly indicate it is Jeffrey Epstein.
The log spans from approximately July 23, 2019, to August 10, 2019, covering the period just before Epstein's death.
It meticulously tracks the inmate's intake of meals, liquids, showers, and behavioral states.
Entries note times the inmate was 'out on legal visit,' indicating meetings with attorneys.
